Vertices

These are the twelve vertices of the icosahedron when the icosahedron is
oriented the way we want to do our mapping. Face 'a' (=ABC) and 'r'
(=ILJ) are the polar faces.

A [-0.5, 0.755761314076171, 0.288675134594813]
B [0.5, 0.755761314076171, 0.288675134594813]
C [0, 0.755761314076171, -0.577350269189626]
D [-0.809016994374947, 0.178411044886545, -0.467086179481358]
E [-0.809016994374947, -0.178411044886545, 0.467086179481358]
F [0, 0.178411044886545, 0.934172358962716]

H [0, -0.178411044886545, -0.934172358962716]
I [-0.5, -0.755761314076171, -0.288675134594813]
J [0, -0.755761314076171, 0.577350269189626]
K [0.809016994374947, -0.178411044886545, 0.467086179481358]
L [0.5, -0.755761314076171, -0.288675134594813]

Faces

These faces are all described such that their vertices go
counter-clockwise around the face as seen from the outside. This
handedness is needed for the face-hit algorithm.
